name: Remedies to be liberally administered
text:
§514B-10  Remedies to be liberally administered.  (a)  The remedies provided by this chapter shall be liberally administered to the end that the aggrieved party is put in as good a position as if the other party had fully performed.  Punitive damages may not be awarded, however, except as specifically provided in this chapter or by other rule of law.
     (b)  Any deed, declaration, bylaw, or condominium map shall be liberally construed to facilitate the operation of the condominium property regime.
     (c)  Any right or obligation declared by this chapter is enforceable by judicial proceeding. [L 2004, c 164, pt of §2; am L 2006, c 273, §4]
